question: Where the famous UNESCO World Heritage Site the "Minaret of Jam" located?
explanation: The Minaret of Jam was built in the 1190s by the great Ghorid Empire. It is a 65-meter high minaret standing like a missile pointing at stars. This once-forgotten imposing structure was rediscovered by Sir Thomas Holdich in 1886. The minaret displays an incredibly intricate baked-brick work, stucco and glazed tile ornamentation.
